title: American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009
summary: The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (ARRA) (Pub.L. 111–5 (text) (pdf)), nicknamed the Recovery Act, was a stimulus package enacted by the 111th U.S. Congress and signed into law by President Barack Obama in February 2009. Developed in response to the Great Recession, the primary objective of this federal statute was to save existing jobs and create new ones as soon as possible. Other objectives were to provide temporary relief programs for those most affected by the recession and invest in infrastructure, education, health, and renewable energy.
